intro: Acer negundo f. koehneanum, commonly known as the Chinese box elder, is a variant of the box elder tree native to China. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and distinctive winged seeds. The plant belongs to the Aceraceae family, though it is now classified under the Sapindaceae family. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in regions with suitable growing conditions.
